Class PurchaseController

java.lang.Object
com.lucas.ticketsalesmanager.controllers.PurchaseController
public class PurchaseController extends Object
Controller to manage purchase processes, including creation, cancellation, and listing of purchases.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PurchaseController()
    Constructs a PurchaseController and initializes the PurchaseDAO.

  • Constructor Details

    • PurchaseController

      public PurchaseController()
      Constructs a PurchaseController and initializes the PurchaseDAO.

  • Method Details

    • processPurchase

      public Purchase processPurchase(User user, Ticket ticket, Payment payment) throws PurchaseException, TicketUnavailableException, PaymentException, InsufficientFundsException
      Processes a new purchase, associating a user, a ticket, and a payment method.
      Parameters:
      user - The user making the purchase.
      ticket - The ticket being purchased.
      payment - The payment method used for the purchase.
      Returns:
      The completed Purchase object.
      Throws:
      PurchaseException - If there's an error during the purchase process.
      TicketUnavailableException - If the ticket is unavailable.
      PaymentException - If there is an issue with the payment.
      InsufficientFundsException - If the user does not have enough funds.

    • cancelPurchase

      public void cancelPurchase(Purchase purchase) throws PurchaseNotFoundException, PurchaseException
      Cancels an existing purchase and reactivates the ticket for future use.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase to cancel.
      Throws:
      PurchaseNotFoundException - If the purchase cannot be found.
      PurchaseException - If there is an error during the cancellation.

    • reactivatePurchase

      public void reactivatePurchase(Purchase purchase) throws PurchaseException
      Reactivates a previously cancelled purchase.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase to reactivate.
      Throws:
      PurchaseException - If the purchase cannot be reactivated.

    • listPurchasesByUser

      public List<Purchase> listPurchasesByUser(User user)
      Lists all purchases made by a specific user.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose purchases to list.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases made by the user.

    • listPurchasesByEvent

      public List<Purchase> listPurchasesByEvent(Event event)
      Lists all purchases associated with a particular event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event whose associated purchases to list.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases for the event.

    • findPurchasesByPaymentMethod

      public List<Purchase> findPurchasesByPaymentMethod(Payment paymentMethod)
      Finds purchases by the payment method used.
      Parameters:
      paymentMethod - The payment method to search by.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases using the specified payment method.

    • findPurchasesByTicket

      public List<Purchase> findPurchasesByTicket(Ticket ticket)
      Retrieves purchases based on the ticket.
      Parameters:
      ticket - The ticket associated with the purchases.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases related to the ticket.

    • findPurchaseByDate

      public Purchase findPurchaseByDate(Date purchaseDate)
      Finds a purchase based on the purchase date.
      Parameters:
      purchaseDate - The date of the purchase.
      Returns:
      The purchase made on the specified date, or null if not found.

    • listAllPurchases

      public List<Purchase> listAllPurchases()
      Lists all purchases made in the system.
      Returns:
      A list of all purchases.
